fields.description:
Let's say you have the following issue filter: http://localhost:8086/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10000.

Back in JIRA 3.6, the XML view for that filter was: http://localhost:8086/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&&query=broken&summary=true&description=true&pid=10000&tempMax=25&reset=true&decorator=none

And in fact you could remove parameters to simplify it down to: http://localhost:8086/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&pid=10000&decorator=none

(Aside: you need the "&decorator=none". Without it you get malformed XML.)

Similarly, you can simply add "?view=rss&decorator=none" on to the original filter: http://localhost:8086/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10000&view=rss&decorator=none.

These all return XML for just the correct issues for that issue filter.

In JIRA 3.7 we changed the URL for XML feeds, and introduced RSS feeds. The equivalent RSS feed URL in 3.7 is: http://localhost:8080/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10000/SearchRequest-10000.xml. Quite different.

If instead you try using the 3.6 syntax, adding "?view=rss&decorator=none" on to the original issue filter URL, it returns an XML view, however it does not return the correct issues for that filter. Instead it returns all the issues that the user has access to.

Aside: in fact it has redirects to the following URL: http://localhost:8080/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?mode=hide&requestId=10000&&decorator=none

You get the same (incorrect) result with just adding "?view=rss". That is, you don't need the "&decorator=none".

Why is this perhaps important? Anton tells me that he believed that when we changed the URL for XML/RSS feeds back in 3.7, we tried to make sure that the old 3.6 links would still work, in case someone had saved them in their browser or in an RSS feed viewer. It appears that we have not done this correctly.

If you think it is important enough, we should fix this so that adding "&view=rss" to an issue filter returns the correct set of issues for that filter.

An important thing to note is that there does *not* appear to be a security/permissions problem here. Although the XML feed with the "?view=rss" returns an incorrect result, it still only returns all the issues that the user has access to. It does not return other issues that the user does not have permission to view.

And of course the workaround is to not append "?view=rss" onto the URL of a search filter.

The same problem exists in version 3.12.1, and hence presumably everything in between.
fields.summary: Adding "?view=rss" to the URL of a search filter returns all issues, not the issues for that filter

fields.description:
Hi there,

All Jira jobs that are raised in our organisation are automatically assigned to a default project. This project is then monitored constantly by our helpdesk, who upon seeing a job in this project determine which project the job should be designated to, and then move the job to the relevant project and assign to the relevant team member.

As our helpdesk must constantly watch for newly created jobs, so that they can be immediately assigned to the correct project, they are  having to manually refresh the dashboard every 60 seconds to update the portlet which shows jobs for the default project.

We would like to request an automatic refresh function be added to the dashboard so that the helpdesk can have it open constantly on a second monitor and check it regularly without having to manually refresh it.

Should you require any further info, please feel free to ask.

Thanks :)
fields.summary: Enable portlet to automatically refresh on the dashboard

fields.description:
STATE OF THE MACHINE:
  ~ user has permissions to access his/her "History" link

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
  1. access / view several issues 
  2. issue summary should contain any of the following chars : single-quote(s), double-quote(s), ampersand(s), greater-than / less-than
  3. now click the "History" link
  4. this opens a new window, displaying the list of twenty (?) most recently viewed issues
  5. observe the issue summaries

RESULT:
  ~ if the summary truncation / break-pt falls immediately on an HTML character entity reference ( &quot &amp &gt &lt ), the HTML char entity ref will be broken and will display a partial representation

EXPECTED / DESIRED RESULT:
  ~ it could be nice to detect if the break-point is in the middle of an HTML character entity ref and then adjust the break-point around that HTML char

WHY:
  ~ just a cleaner implementation ...

ADDITIONAL COMMENTS:
  ~ obviously a very, very low priority :)
fields.summary: Recent History filter : issue summary break-point may occur mid html char entity ref

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14398].
  {panel}

From Customer:

The suggested changes in server.xml differ on two sites:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Datasource+for+Oracle+10g+JDBC+drivers

{code:xml}
<Context path="/jira" docBase="path/to/atlassian-jira-3.11.war">
<Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
username="...."
password="...."
driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"
url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@<database host machine>:<port>:<SID>"
connectionProperties="SetBigStringTryClob=true" />
<Resource name="UserTransaction" auth="Container" type="javax.transaction.UserTransaction"
factory="org.objectweb.jotm.UserTransactionFactory"
jotm.timeout="60"/>
<Manager className="org.apache.catalina.session.PersistentManager" saveOnRestart="false"/>
</Context>
{code}

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/oracle.html
{code:xml}
<Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
username="[enter db username]"
password="[enter db password]"
driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"
url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:jiradb"
connectionProperties="SetBigStringTryClob=true"
maxActive="20"/>
{code}

We use the first one on our new config (10gR2) with Jira Standalone however before we used the second one:
What should we use fromm the different config's:

    * <Manager className="org.apache.catalina.session.PersistentManager" saveOnRestart="false"/>
    * maxActive="20"

When creating a user normally an option is provided to mail the new user with username and password details.

'External Password Management' in the GUI disables this option and does not mail the user if the option was previously ticked or not.

In some circumstances it may be useful to send the initial JIRA username / password details.

fields.description:
The notification email will fail (partly) to send if there is a custom field (i.e. user or group picker) which has already been deleted from the system.  

{noformat}* Current Assignee  (Delete)
* Reporter (Delete)
* All Watchers (Delete)
* User Custom Field Value (Multi User pIcker) (Delete)
* Single Email Address (tchin@atlassian.com) (Delete)
* Single User (admin) (Delete){noformat}

If the notifications for an event is set up like the above and if "Multi User pIcker" is removed from JIRA, the notification email number 4 and 5 will fail.
fields.summary: Notification Fails Because of Invalid Custom Field

fields.description:
When removing a custom field (e.g multi user picker, user picker), there is no checking to check if the custom field is being used in the notification schemes or permission schemes.

{noformat}2008-01-21 11:36:30,329 http-55445-Processor22 ERROR [webwork.util.ServletValueStack] METHOD: "argumentDisplay", exception: 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Custom field with id 'customfield_10031' does not exist.
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DefaultFieldManager.getCustomField(DefaultFieldManager.java:618)
	at com.atlassian.jira.notification.type.UserCFValue.getArgumentDisplay(UserCFValue.java:144)
...{noformat}
This is the error that will be thrown by JIRA when an invalid custom field is viewed at the notification schemes.  The more this custom field is used in the notification schemes, the more the error will be thrown and the longer it takes to load the notification scheme.
fields.summary: No Checking (Permission/Notification Schemes) When Removing a Custom Field

fields.description: The last step of the fogbugz import wizard asks the user to either save the settings in a properties file, or run through the import without saving.  If the user selects save config file, but doesn't enter a filename, no validation error is thrown, and you get straight back to the start of the wizard.  Effectively loosing all your settings.
fields.summary: Fogbugz import wizard does not validate form data when saving configuration file

fields.description: In the action ViewIssueFields.java (an action that has about half a dozen commands), the {{store()}} method is not thread safe.  This can cause problems when we are creating the Default Field Config for the first time.  It can result in 2 database entries (in {{fieldlaout}} table) and this causes a lot of things to blow up.
fields.summary: Concurrency issue with default field configs can cause multiple entries in the database

fields.description:

After talking to Anton and Ian, we do not want to give the impression that we support this database because not very many people use it and it costs us some time.
fields.summary: MaxDB documentation should be dropped in version 4.0.

fields.description:
If a project has a double-quote in its name, it's not xml-escaped when used in "title" attribute. For example, if we have a project named 14" monitors, the html will look like:

<select name="pid" ....>
  <option title="14" monitors" value="10000" >14" monitors</option>

This causes JIRA Client to hiccup on this page and lose a lot of functionality. On web browser, the title is displayed incorrectly.

I can only imagine what would happen if a project contained the following characters: "></html> :)
fields.summary: Project name that contains double-quote is not properly escaped on Issue Navigator page

fields.description:
If JIRA is configured to trust a Confluence server, and receives a RSS request from it, except that the IP address doesn't match, then JIRA sends back a response containing:

{noformat}
X-Seraph-Trusted-App-Status: ERROR
X-Seraph-Trusted-App-Error: Invalid certificate
{noformat}

which Confluence displays:

!conf_invalidcerterror.png!

This message is unhelpful and misleading. What is a "certificate", and why is it invalid? Users don't know or care. The error message ought to be something like "JIRA is not configured to trust the caller's IP address".
fields.summary: Misleading "Invalid certificate" error message when trusted apps IP address not allowed

fields.description:
We have a two specific instances where we wish to have a custom date field which shows only on the close issue screen to default to the current date.  Instead, it defaults to the date the issue was created.  This field was removed from the default (edit) screens, and create issue screens, yet is showing the default date as the issue's creation date, not current date.  

Would it be possible to apply the current date when the field is in 'edit' view rather than the issue creation date?

(This relates to JRA-8265)
fields.summary: When a date field is set to default to 'now' it is set to the issue creation date, not to the date of when the field appears to be edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14378].
  {panel}

The solution provided to JRA-8497 will not work in our case.
This is related to the 'working as designed' described in JRA-10210

We would like the clone ability to be shut off for only one project in our JIRA.  This is because when an issue is cloned, it does not automatically get assigned to the default assignee and therefore there is not an e-mail sent via our notification scheme to the appropriate persons.  We are encouraging users to re-open issues rather than clone them so they are not lost.  However, this is not working so nicely.   Is there a way to simply turn 'clone' off for a single project without affecting all projects within that instance of JIRA?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict 'Clone Issue' by PROJECT
Dashboard draws issues bar outside of project box

Scanning CSS and JSP page, it appears that this color is provided by different class and also as bgcolor value in HTML tags.

Is it possible for future release, to provide a solution to change these values ...
* Prefer usage of CSS in HTML Tags
* Migrate CSS in velocity templates
* other solution ?
fields.summary: Look 'n Feel - Pastel Colors are not visible with Dell TFT monitors

fields.description:
Hello,

I was playing around the SOAP client to edit some Worklog entries. I assumes that the following code would be able to change the comment of a Worklog entry:

{code:java}
public class WorklogTest
{
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
    {
        URL url = new URL("http://localhost:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2");

        JiraSoapServiceServiceLocator jiraSoapServiceGetter = new JiraSoapServiceServiceLocator();
        JiraSoapService jiraSoapService = jiraSoapServiceGetter.getJirasoapserviceV2(url);

        String token = jiraSoapService.login("admin", "admin");

        RemoteWorklog[] logs = jiraSoapService.getWorklogs(token, "ONE-1");
        if (logs.length > 0)
        {
        
            logs[0].setComment("Qwerty");
            jiraSoapService.updateWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate(token, logs[0]);
        }
    }
}
{code}

However, when I try to execute the code I get the following exception:
{code}

	at com.atlassian.jira_soapclient.WorklogTest.main(WorklogTest.java:33)
{code}

This seems the be caused by the fact that the server expects  a different interval format  as input from the one it returns when querying an issue. When the server returns a Worklog it sets Worklog.timeSpent to a human readable string (e.g. 15 days, 3 hours). However, when processing an input Worklog the server expects Worklog.timeSpent to be set to a JIRA input interval (e.g 15d 3h). 

Later,
Brenden.
fields.summary: Unable to update comment on worklog using SOAP.

fields.description:
In a CSV or tab-delimited file, usernames that I want to import are in the format:  "firstname lastname".  We are integrated with LDAP, so all users are in this format.

When I try to import, I'm trying to populate a User Picker field.  I choose not to Create new users.

For whatever reason Jira can't find existing users and instead pops the message that I need to create users in the format: firstnamelastname (no space).

The importer does not properly recognize the space as a valid character for importing into User picker fields.

I filed a support ticket late last year and Andreas kindly created a username mapper that can import users with spaces in their name.

I feel like a special mapper shouldn't be needed.  If I provide a valid username in an import, JIRA should recognize it, whether or not it has spaces.  It should stop trying to be clever (auto-account creation) or at least have an option to turn that off.  Actually, the option is there, but it doesn't work if usernames contain spaces.
fields.summary: Problems importing usernames with spaces into a User Picker field

I would like to keep track of all the versions an issue has been scheduled in. I created a custom field for versions. I then do a bulk update at the start of the version of this field so that even if the fix version changes, I still have the original version there. However, if that same issue gets again re-scheduled, I now loose the first version that was already there if I do a bulk update. I would have to manually select both versions for that issue.

What I would like is the ability to say "add this new value to the already existing values" in a bulk change. This can be very useful to add a new label for instance to issues also.

fields.description:
The comments and issues rss feeds presented by filters (the comments and issues links) have several problems that make them less than useful to us:

1) The links are only included in the html as normal links, not in the html header of the page, this makes it impossible to subscribe to the feeds from IE7 and harder than it has to be in all other feed readers, please include something like this for *all* feeds mentioned on a page:
  <link rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="$titleOfFeed" href="$linkToFeed" />

2) The names of the mentioned RSS feeds are set to the name of the filter, meaning that it's impossible to tell the difference between the issues and comments feeds, please set the feed title to something like $filterName - issues or $filterName - comments

3) The mime type used for feeds is: text/xml;charset=UTF-8, this causes IE7 to not recognize the RSS feed when the user just clicks the issues and comments links, please set the mime type for all RSS feeds to application/rss+xml.


... oh and remember to encode the entities for values in RSS feeds as reported in JRA-14366.
fields.summary: RSS feeds presented by filters (labeled comments and issues) do not show up in html headers, have useless names and the wrong mime type

fields.description: When I create an RSS feed from a filter which contains "special" characters like & the generated RSS feed is not valid XML as the description/name of the filter makes it into the RSS feed without being escaped.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 7th Sep 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#dddddd|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

We're excited to announce that the ability to split issue is available in JIRA Software 7.5 starting from today!
We really appreciate your patience with this feature request, and apologize for our silence on the matter. We also appreciate the insights in this thread - it helped a ton in the design and prioritization of split issue.

As we've mentioned before, our Cloud and Server deployment options are now on separate roadmaps ([read more here|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/prioritizing-roadmaps-cloud-server-data-center]), but this is a great example of a new feature shipped in cloud, that was popular and prioritized with server customers, that we have brought into server.

JIRA Software 7.5 is now available to [download|https://atlassian.com/software/jira/download] so you can start planning your upgrade straight away!
Learn more in our [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-release-notes-776821069.html].

Cheers,
Jakub Lazinski
Product Manager, JIRA Server
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14360].
{panel}
Sometimes some issues grow to span several problems. This can happen very often at early stage of Jira adoption.
 It would be very nice to have ability to easily split issue in two ones, without a mailstorm.
 Desirable options for extracted issue:
 - copy some fields/metadata, set new values to others
 - move selected comments
 - move selected attachments
 All this should produce only one notification.
fields.summary: Split issue

fields.description:
A customer has requested that we add a feature allowing the user to create a sub-task for more than one issue at once. 

He has been reading our documentation on [integrating JIRA with test case management tools|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACOM/Test+Case+Management+Tool+Integration+Discussion+%28Archived%29]. He likes the idea, but says that "it seems to fall down in the sense you need to quickly define the test cases that will be run in a release and since the way you define one is a sub task if you can't create one per testcase it falls down quickly ".
fields.summary: Create a subtask for multiple issues at the same time

fields.description:
JIRA supports 'archiving' versions but does not support that for components. That's bad because list of components may grow to a very large extent; full list of those components may be still useful for searching, but not all the list must be necessarily available for selection in a dropdown field when creating an issue. This creates a big usability problem for QA folks.

*Example*: every release adds, say, up to 10 components; relevant testing that follows mostly focuses on those new components rather than existing 100, which forces QA personnel to scroll a 100-entry list every time they file a bug. Scrolling a 10-entry list would be a whole lot easier and error-proof.
fields.summary: Enable archiving components

fields.description:
A database MSSQL database DBA became confused with our MSSSQL 2005 instructions [http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/sqlserver.html] as outlined in [JSP-19303|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-19303].

The main problem is that the took "schema" to mean the traditional DB term [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Database_schema] rather than the MSSQL 2005 definition. We probably just need to clarify what is said.

Maybe something like:

{quote}
3. Create an empty schema (e.g. jiraschema) in the database for the JIRA tables. A [schema|http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms190387.aspx] is a new security object introduced in SQL Server 2005. Please consult Microsoft's [documentation|http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms189462.aspx] for information on how to create a schema in SQL Server 2005.

NOTE: You should only create an empty schema, you do not need to create any of JIRA's tables, fields or relationships. JIRA will create these database objects in your empty schema when it starts up for the first time. 
{quote}

Come and grab me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Brenden.
fields.summary: MSSQL 2005 Documentation is confusing customers

fields.description:
We still get a number of support customers who go and use the EAR/WAR version, even with Tomcat, because they think that they can only use JIRA Standalone with the bundled HSQL database. So...

In the "Which 'Distribution Should You Choose?" section of http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/requirements.html, can we please make it more obvious that you can use JIRA Standalone with any supported database.

I realize that we do state this down at the bottom of the page - "Before deploying to a production environment, we strongly recommend that you connect JIRA Standalone to an enterprise database (see the list of supported databases)." - but I suspect that this is too late. The customer has made their decision by then based on the "Which 'Distribution Should You Choose?" section at the top of the page.

Anyway, that's my opinion on why the problem is occurring. I'd also welcome any other suggestions about how to improve the documentation to stop this happening.
fields.summary: Emphasize that JIRA Standalone can be re-configured to use a "real" database

fields.description:
One of our user reported the following:
----
I discovered the reason why JIRA sometimes closes my IE session, it depends on the way you login:
1) When you login via navigation to your home page (http://support/jira/secure/Dashboard.jspa ) all is ok, multiple JIRA sessions never expire.
2) When you login via starting up your browser and you click a favorite that is a shortcut to for example your private queries page, you get a message you are not logged in. When you then use the small login link on top of the page, 2 things can happen:
A) an infinite browser refresh of the home page, you need to kill your browser and pray again.
B) you are transferred to the home page ( http://support/jira/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FIssueNavigator.jspa%3Fmode%3Dhide%26requestId%3D10447) and you login there, but somehow now a session time out is used so if you have opened after that a second browser window on JIRA, one (or all) of the sessions is closed when unattended for some time.

Note this login timeout issue applies to IE6 and the firefox browser. (however, infinite refresh only seen on IE)
fields.summary: Different IE browser windows have different sessions and different session timeout timing

fields.description:
If the user "new-user" does not exist when the following Jelly script is run:

{code}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:AddUserToGroup username="new-user" group-name="jira-users"/>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

then the error message is:

{code}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='EditUserGroups'>
    <TagContents>(AddUserToGroup(username=new-user)(group-name=jira-users))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=ian</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>Tag AddUserToGroup requires (jelly.username, jelly.new.username, jelly.group.name) variables to be set in the Context</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

Could we improve this to display a more meaningful error message (i.e. that the user does not exist)?
fields.summary: Improve error message for Jelly AddUserToGroup tag if user does not exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14329].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA can create a new user based on the From: field of an email, but not the CC: field.

This is related to [JRA-9983|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9983] which extends the ability to add CC: recipients on an email as watchers on an issue. This has been implemented and is scheduled for a JIRA 4.0 release, however if any of the CC: recipients are not currently users of JIRA then that recipient is silently discarded from the watcher list.

It would be useful in some circumstances that when an issue is being commented on via email, an existing user could then add a CC recipient to the email and then the JIRA handler, provided configured, could then create and then add this user via [JRA-9983|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9983], so that this new user would be able to comment and follow the progress of that issue.

However this introduces a problem of what permissions to give the new user..
fields.summary: Create users that do not exist from the CC list of e-mails
Bulk operations should read bulkEditBean.isSendBulkNotification once, not for each issue.

fields.description:
The new QuickSearch features that Sam C added have a problem on Websphere. 

If you put in a search string like "five c:five five" then it correctly identifies the component as the one named five however the rest of the query string is reported as "five++five" and not "five   five".

QuickSearch action does an internal redirect to Navigator actions.

It seems that on other app servers the URL parameters are decoded during an internal RequestDispatcher redirect.  I strongly suspect (but have not fully proven yet) that WAS does not decode query parms during internal redirects.

It seems to work ok on WAS if you invoke directly in the browser but that may be the browser doing the decoding.  Again I havent proved this.

{noformat}
IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=show&summary=true&description=true&body=true&query=five++six&component=10011&component=10010&component=10012&component=10014&component=10013&usedQuickSearch=true&originalQuickSearchQuery=five+c%3Afive+six
{noformat}
fields.summary: WAS 5.1 and QuickSearch have problems

fields.description:
The IssueSecurityLevelManager finds the list of Security Levels available to a user for a given Project or Issue.
The problem is that we cache the results against the project even if it was a query for an issue, and also we use the List cached against the project even if it is an issue query.

This leads to incorrect results when the Issue Level Security scheme includes permissions like "reporter" or "assignee".

Please see TestPromptUserForSecurityLevelOnMove.testMoveProject_Issue_SecurityLevelNotAvailableToUser() for a func test that was failing because of this bug.
Note, however, that this test was not written specifically or this particular issue, so it may randomly pass.

Bug exists in IssueLevelSecurities.getUsersSecurityLevels()
fields.summary: The Project/User/Security Level Cache can be over eager and grant incorrect Security Levels to users.

fields.description: Has there been any investigation into the integration of Jira into gForge?  gForge has it's own issue tracking environment and it could be good for Atlassian to provide their own gForge mods/patches to integrate with Jira instead - I know I'd use it.
fields.summary: Jira integration with gForge

fields.description:
We have are developing a plugin that adds a tab panel to a project in the "Browse Project" section.
We are overriding the showPanel method ( inherited from AbstractProjectTabPanel.java ) to hide or show the panel on a per project basis.

However, when using multiple project portlets on the dashboard, the showPanel(... , ...) method is called only once and uses the currently selected project. So every project that are shown on the dashboard in project portlets might have or not the tab panel, according to the currently selected project.

Would it be possible to call the showPanel method on every project portlet to show or hide the tab panel ?

To reproduce the problem:
1) create a project tab panel plugin that is available for a subset of your projects
2) add 2 project portlets, 1 in this subset and another  that isn't
3) Browse to the project that is in the subset
4) return to the dashboard
now both projects should have the tab panel activated.

Thanks for your time
fields.summary: When developing a project tab plugin, the showPanel method is called only once for all of the project portlets on the dashboard.

fields.description:
On JAC, the Seraph project has group 'atlassian-developers' assigned to the 'Developers' role:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/project/ViewProjectRoleActors.jspa?projectId=10480

The 'atlassian-developers' group has 89 members:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa?emailFilter=&group=atlassian-developers

However, against the project in the 'View Project Role Usage' screen, it shows only '1 member'. Presumably, it's counting the group as a single member when it should be counting the number of users in the group.

This confused me for a few minutes. I thought the role was incorrectly configured, but after a while discovered that I just wasn't in the group.
fields.summary: View Project Role Usage screen shows incorrect member count for roles which contain groups

fields.description:
Step to reproduce this problem

# Create two project and two new issue type scheme.
# Set up the default issue type for the newly created issue type schemes (e.g, New Feature). 
# Try to create an issue 

You will find that both projects are preselected on issue type Bug (first on the list of issue type). Please note that the problem cannot replicate if only one project is created and that both projects must be associate with different issue type scheme.
fields.summary: Default issue type is not being pickup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14317].
  {panel}

I think this issue should be part of resolving [\[#JRA-9941\] new notification type for "Sub-task of issue created"|JRA-9941] but if it goes faster I would really prefer to have the _standalone_ fix:

We have a notification scheme which informs every developer about new issues in a project. This is nice as it is easy to keep track of new issues or add comments if you know more about it.

*But there is a problem:* As _Issue Created_ notification also applies to Sub-Tasks the developers get a huge heap of unwanted notification mails.

This is because we use Sub-Tasks as a way a developers might organize their work to document step by step approach. Thus most of the time such sub-tasks are more like private todos than anything interesting to the public.

*I suggest* to have a separate notification called _Sub-Task created_ which is independent from _Issue created_.

If resolving JRA-9941 it might still be good to have the two notifications introduced here just in case you want to simulate the old behavior, i. e. getting Sub-Task created mails just as Sub-Task for Issue created (as proposed by JRA-9941).
fields.summary: Notifications: Separate Issue Created from (new) Sub-Task created

fields.description:
Users would like to know what views and auditing information is available for issues, but this doesn't appear to be mentioned in the JIRA documentation. Please add a table listing the various tabs and their purpose to the 'What is an issue?' page at:

   http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/issues.html

This should include all the core tabs and mention the optional source repository integration tabs.
fields.summary: Add information on issue tabs such as 'Change history' to 'What is an issue?' page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14314].
  {panel}

For fields with Wiki Markup, it would be useful to be able to switch the markup off for a section of text.
eg if a section contains a number of special characters, it is simpler and cleaner to turn markup off for the whole section, rather than having to escape each individual character.

Note that there already exists a tag called "noformat".
{noformat}
Unfortunately it ACTUALLY produces "preformatted" text like this.
It may be nice to deprecate this tag, and rename to "preformat".
{noformat}
Because "noformat" is not available, another suggested name would be "nowiki" or "nomarkup".

See JRA-14297 for more information.

I just saw in JRA-8175 a suggestion that wiki markup fields could act like "plain text" by default, and only switch to wiki markup if a particular tag occured to TURN IT ON.
This seems like an even better suggestion, as the user that knows about wiki is the one who turns it on. This could be a configurable option in the Wiki field, and could default to current behaviour for backward compatibility.
fields.summary: Introduce a wiki tag that says that no Wiki formatting takes place inside it.

fields.description:
This is related to this support issue:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-18752?focusedCommentId=193843#action_193843

{quote}
It seems that the exception is logged when the user does the following action:

- click on an attachment in a JIRA issue
- IE pop-up offers "save", "open", "cancel"
- users clicks on "cancel"

The behavior on the frontend is fine but an exception is logged. This should not happen normally.
{quote}

Filing a request for improvement.

regards,

Neeraj
fields.summary: An exception is unnecessarily logged when the user clicks to cancel an attachment's download

fields.description: When troubleshooting email handling, it's hard to see if the jelly script is handling the email properly. Perhaps this logging should be done in jelly scripts. Also, outbound email notifications don't have their own logging. These could be commented by default.
fields.summary: Add email handler and outbound email logging to log4j.properties

fields.description: Currently the only way to configure a session is by modifying the web.xml file.  The major shortcoming of this approach is that the change is transient.  Web.xml gets overwritten every time the war file is rebuild or Jira is upgraded.  The session timeout value must be configurable via the administrative interface and must be persisted in the database.
fields.summary: Ability to configure a persistant session timeout

fields.description:
Our customer has configured jira-application.properties file in such a way that also the reporter field appears in the sub-task's quick create form.

When using IE6 or IE7, the user picker pop-up shown "Error on page" message. The more detailed error message is:

"Line: 284
Char: 5
Error: 'elements.reporter' is null or not an object
Code: 0
URL: http://.../secure/popups/UserPckerBrowser.jspa?formName=jiraform&element=reporter

With Firefox selecting reporter works fine.
fields.summary: JavaScript error on IE when selecting reporter via sub-task's quick create form

fields.description:
Add a way to declare some projects "private" so that they are visible ONLY to some users. The project name should not be visible to the other users.

For instance, if I create a "public JIRA" to allow my customers to enter issues, I don't want the other customers to know about the project (in the project list for instance). Only some users should be allowed (explicitly) to see this project.

Once the project is displayed, other permissions apply.
fields.summary: Add possibility to make projects visible only to by some users
Sorting Select List For Permission List

fields.description:
A client has reported that JIRA Standard runs well on glassfish v2 :
"FYI - your docs don't say it (or I couldn't find it) but JIRA standard runs nicely on glassfish v2, in fact we found the setup easier than running the generic WAR on tomcat."

I suggest adding to the documentation if devs/support feels it is appropriate.
fields.summary: Doc this: "JIRA Standard runs nicely on glassfish v2" - Client Experience

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA offers two options for navigator columns.  There is a default version of the navigator columns that every user will see, and there is an ability for an individual user to override those column choices.

When you have many different JIRA projects being used for different internal processes, the columns that are important for a particular project can vary greatly.  This is especially true when a project introduces special custom fields which are necessary for understanding the state of issues in that project.

It would be nice if an administrator could set the default navigator columns that a user should use for searching through a given project.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default navigator columns by project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14302].
  {panel}

I would like to see following feature in JIRA such that I can use the software as our client support system.

* Ability to limit number of issues a user/group can create.

Users are given certain number of tickets based on the support contract they have in place. Once they reach the issue limit for particular level of support, they should not be able to create new issues.

* A portlet which check the number of issue available for a user/group and display it. When the user run out of allocated number of issues, ability to display a customizable message.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict number of issues a user/group can create
Remove obsolete incoming link automatically (trackback)

fields.description:
There is a typo error with this plugin (JIRA Toolkit).  A module in the plugin is as follows:
bq. Comapre Number Custom Field (compare-number-condition) 

Should it be 'Comapre' or 'Compare'?  This is also visible while adding a condition in a workflow transition.

Attached image:
# Configuring the plugin at Administration
# While adding to condition to transition
fields.summary: JIRA Toolkit Plugin has a typo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14299].
  {panel}

When I "MOVE" an Issue to a new project, you never get a screen asking for required changes to fields of that issues subtask.
On the confirm page you get a warning:
bq. Note: Sub-Tasks associated with this issue will lose data stored in fields not applicable in the target.

However, a Bulk Move operation works differently.
We get a step in the wizard to ask the user to change values of fields that require adjusting.

It would be nice if this was consistent.
fields.summary: The treatment of subtasks of an issue that is moved is different between (single) Move and Bulk Move.

fields.description:
See page http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12/querysyntax.html?clicked=jirahelp under the Fuzzy Searches section.

In the "normal" part of the text: "To do a fuzzy search use the tilde, "\~", symbol", the tilde symbol is just recognisable, but in the code sample below ("roam\~"), the tilde is indistinguishable from a minus ('-') character.

I have not tested this on other browsers/OS's so I am not sure how platform dependent this is.
fields.summary: The font for JIRA docs is not good for displaying a tilde (~) character.

fields.description:
Without time tracking enabled, the sub-task list has a progress bar ([image from 3.0 release notes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/7231/subtask-viewissue.gif]) based on how many sub-tasks are resolved.

If time tracking is enabled, you can only track sub-task progress by using time tracking.  There is no way to see the simpler "resolution-based" progress bar.  Since entering time estimates is optional, I would have expected the old progress bar to still be visible if no time estimates had been entered in any of the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Sub-task progress bar disappears if time tracking enabled

fields.description:
When you bulk move an issue, JIRA checks if any of the fields need user input to be changed.
eg if Security Level will be a required field after the move, but is currently none, then we prompt the user for the new Security Level.
If a default Security Level exists, then the drop-down should default to this.

This currently works in single Move, but not Bulk Move.
fields.summary: Bulk Move does not default the Security Level drop to the default value.
Make JIRA SOAP client work against jira.atlassian.com
Implement the Crowd 'requiresPasswordChange' attribute upon login.

fields.description: If a Thread waiting for another thread to load the value of a LazyReference is interrupted, an infinite loop is triggered. Kind of the opposite to what would be expected.
fields.summary: Live-lock in the interrupt handling of the ThreadsafeLazyLoadedReference

fields.description:
One feature that would make my life much easier is if Jira would introduce a per-user configurable setting that would allow you to automatically collapse all sub-tasks under its parent.  I'm basically thinking of Mozilla Thunderbird's mail message threading feature...something similar in Jira would make it a lot easier for me to see which sub-tasks belong to a parent.

I know there is a way to do this by using the search system and grouping by task -- the main difference in my suggestion is that a) this behavior would be user specific and b) it would happen by default (if enabled) when you open up a project.

Thanks!
fields.summary: User preference to allow subtasks to collapse under parent by default

fields.description:
While creating a Issue I can give a due date which occurs before the date of creation itself.
Can you please confirm this and give me some work around.
fields.summary: Due date allows to enter a date which is older than date of creation itself

fields.description:
For resampling of attached screen-shots JIRA seems uses basic *Pixel Resize* algorithm which breaks image.
It's hard to view content of the image from the thumbnail so as result each time I have to open image to see the source picture.
If use *Weighted Average* algorithm for thumbnails generation, the quality will improve essentially.

See screen-shots attached with comparison of two algorithm results - original image was 50% resized.
fields.summary: More advanced resampling algorithm for generation of thumbnails
${catalina.base}/logs/ should be the base directory for logs

fields.description:
It would really be great to understand in what context a comment was written.   

The user is given the opportunity to add comments for many operations such as attachments, resolutions, linking etc.

In many cases, it would add much clarity if you could see the reason that comment exists.

Very similar to JRA-1062 but go further and  include a reason for all comments.
fields.summary: Comment Context

fields.description: At the moment, when adding a portlet it is hard to find the one you are looking for.  It will be trivial to sort this list by name before displaying.

fields.summary: NullPointerException when clicking on email filter subscription edit link when not logged into JIRA

fields.description:
At our company we have a private installation of JIRA.

Many of my users whom I administrate contact me to retrieve their JIRA username. I believe the problem stems from a few things in the UI.

* The link that allows you to retrieve your username says "Forgot Password" and this is located on the login screen when JIRA is running in Private mode.
*  When you click "Forgot Password" the word "Here" is used to tell the user to click to get their username, from what I understand web standards many of these recommend not to using the word "here" to describe any link. Instead describe the link by it's action, and in this case reword the message associated with the 'here' link
* Finally, the message used to perform the "Here" link is small and has no header like the big "FORGOT PASSWORD" text is displayed  in the ForgotPassword!default.jspa box

Please improve this by improving  the following

* Making the link for the username more clear by changing the login message at  to state "Forgot Username/Password" or Creating a new link next to "Forgot Password" called "Forgot Username" which takes you directly to *ForgotUsernames!default.jspa*
* or  If a combination link is created then please improve the messaging.

This could make it easier to tell the end user that they can retrieve this information automatically as long as their JIRA e-mail set in their account/JIRA profile is up to date.

Naturally if the later is not correct  I will still have to do it for them, but these tiny little improvements may help go along way.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Method of allowing an end-user to retrieve their JIRA Username on their own is obscure.

fields.description:
Now the email from a filter only shows the ID, the Title and a link for each bug the filter returns.

Ideally, the mail would have the same contents as the columns choosen in the filter.  If too difficult, it would be an improvement to include the status an resolution fields, because now the mail give too little information to be sufficient

I attached the workflow to my project and started filing an issue
On Save I got NullPointerException error (see stack.txt and errorui.jpg) though the issue was created 

When I tried to detach the workflow from my project tp correct it I didn't manage to do this until I delete the issue.

fields.description:
Right now the default Due date field just allows me to pick a day as the actual due date. I would like to be able to choose a day and time as the due date for each issue. 

I can create a custom field to do this but that wont allow me to hook it in with the Schedule Issues permission scheme. 

Please let me know if there is a way to do this or to add it as a feature.
